snippet: The United States should insist on protections against currency manipulation as part of any trade agreement it enters into, an economist writes.
abstract: The United States should insist on protections against currency manipulation as part of any trade agreement it enters into, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”
